meanings.definition: A person who receives a salary for their work.
meanings.sent1: The salariats in the office were happy to receive their paychecks.
meanings.sent2: The company hired more salariats to help with the workload.
meanings.sent3: The salariats decided to have a potluck lunch to celebrate payday.
meanings.sent4: The salariats were the backbone of the organization, keeping things running smoothly.
meanings.sent5: Every Friday, the salariats eagerly awaited their direct deposits.

meanings.definition: The collective group of individuals who are paid a salary for their labor.
meanings.sent1: During the meeting, the salariats discussed their upcoming projects.
meanings.sent2: The salariats voted to negotiate for better benefits.
meanings.sent3: At the company picnic, the salariats dominated the tug-of-war competition.
meanings.sent4: The salariats stood united in their demand for fair wages.
meanings.sent5: In the bustling office, the salariats worked diligently to meet deadlines.
